sect1.title: Starting GnomeSword
sect1.para: You can start GnomeSword in the following ways:

listitem.para: Choose Accessories Gnomesword2 Bible Study Guide .

sect1.title: Starting GnomeSword For The First Time
sect1.para: When you start GnomeSword for the first time, a simple Setup Assistant appears. This will enable you to configure your choice of SWORD Project modules. It also enables you to set basic user interface options. Once your done with this, you should be presented with the GnomeSword interface.

sect1.title: Launching GnomeSword
sect1.para: When you start GnomeSword, the following interface is displayed:
The GnomeSword interface contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain several commands which extend the use of GnomeSword . These include the StudyPad and advanced search functions.The menus also allow you to customize your use of GnomeSword.
The toolbar contains buttons that let you quickly navigate through the Bible.
The Sidebar provides access to several features. It contains your bookmarks and the list of installed books. It can also be used to perform simple searches.
The Bible Text pane displays the Bible text which is currently being viewed.
The Viewer displays bible text module options. This includes strong numbers, footnotes and morphological tags. It is located just below the Bible Text Pane.
The Commentary pane displays commentaries on the current Bible Text being used.

The Book Pane displays general books available from the Sword Project. These include modules like "Calvin's Institutes", "Josephus: The Complete Works" etc. This Pane can be accessed via the Book View tab just below the Commentary Pane.
The Dictionary/Book Pane displays dictionary information on selected words in the Bible Text Pane. It is located just below the Commentary Pane

sect1.para: When you right-click in the different interface sections, the interface displays a popup menu, which allows you to access more module specific options. These include printing services.
